summary: The Plastic Health Research Act (HR 4903) amends the Public Health Service Act to enhance research on plastic exposure and its health effects. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services, in collaboration with other agencies, to expand and coordinate research programs. The bill authorizes grants for research on plastic exposure, including the development of testing methodologies, standard definitions, and filling research gaps. It also establishes Centers of Excellence for research and requires reports to Congress. Appropriations of $10 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030 are authorized.
